abstract: Release of 350 page document from 2010 sheds light on surveillance program established by Bush administration to counteract terrorism after September 11; call records of millions of Americans obtained by National Security Agency under secret interpretation of provision in Patriot Act was deemed illegal by appeals court ruling in early May.
lead_paragraph: A document obtained by The New York Times also showed that AT&T and Sprint were involved in the bulk domestic phone records program.

headline.main: N.S.A. Used Phone Records Program to Seek Iran Operatives
headline.print_headline: N.S.A. Used Phone Data to Seek Iran Operatives

snippet: A document obtained by The New York Times also showed that AT&T and Sprint were involved in the bulk domestic phone records program.

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
